intro: Psorospermum cuspidatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and small, white to pinkish flowers. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
